metadata.title: CVE-2024-32460 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol. FreeRDPbased based clients using `/bpp:32` legacy `GDI` drawing path with aversion of FreeRDP prior to 3.5.0 or 2.11.6 are vulnerable to out-of-boundsread. Versions 3.5.0 and 2.11.6 patch the issue. As a workaround, usemodern drawing paths (e.g. `/rfx` or `/gfx` options). The workaroundrequires server side support.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-32460` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6').
